title: Express Talk: Adorning the Medieval House
hero_caption: The Lovers, 1490/1500. Basel (present-day Switzerland). Gift of Kate S. Buckingham.
description:
While modern audiences associate medieval European art with great churches and cathedrals, rulers of the time also commissioned refined artworks to adorn castles, palaces, and public spaces. In this gallery talk, Mellon Curatorial Fellow Scott Miller draws attention to the diversity of late medieval secular and courtly art in the collection of the Art Institute, revealing how artwork provided the stage for the performance of social life.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an e-mail to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
